1.t: Have you heard the story of the overwhelming event (the Day of Judgment)?

2.t: On that day the faces of some people will be humbly cast down,

3.t: troubled and tired as a result of their deeds in the past.

4.t: They will suffer the heat of the blazing fire

5.t: and will be made to drink from a fiercely boiling spring.

6.t: They will have no food other than bitter and thorny fruit
6.tr: Laisa lahum ta'aamun illaa min daree'

7.t: which will neither fatten them nor satisfy them.
7.tr: Laa yusminu Wa-laa yughnee min joo'

8.t: However, on that day the faces of other people will be happy.

9.t: and pleased with the result of their deeds in the past.

10.t: They will live in an exalted garden

11.t: wherein they will not hear any vain talk.

12.t: Therein will be a flowing spring,

17.t: Have they not looked at how the camel is created,
17.tr: Afalaa yanzuroona ilal ibili kaifa khuliqat

18.t: how the heavens are raised up high,

19.t: how the mountains are set firm,

20.t: and how the earth is spread out?

21.t: (Muhammad), preach; you are only a preacher.

22.t: You do not have full control over them.

23.t: However, those who turn away and disbelieve,

24.t: God will punish them with the greatest torment.

25.t: To Us they will all return.

26.t: In Our hands are their accounts.
